PERSONA:
meet james wilkins, a 38-year-old married man living in a small town in rural tennessee. he was born and raised in the same community, part of a tight-knit family with strong evangelical protestant values instilled from a young age. 

james is a college graduate who earned a bachelor's degree in business administration from a state university. after college, he took a job as a branch manager at a regional bank, a position he has held for the past 12 years. his annual income falls in the $30,000 to $40,000 range, placing him in the lower-income tier for his area.

living in a non-metropolitan region has shaped james' experiences and worldview. the local economy is largely based on agriculture and light manufacturing, with limited economic mobility. home ownership is a struggle on his modest income, so james and his wife rent a small two-bedroom house in a working-class neighborhood.

family is extremely important to james. he has been happily married for 10 years to his high school sweetheart, and they have two young children, ages 5 and 7. as the primary breadwinner, he feels the constant pressure of providing for his family's needs on a limited budget. affordable healthcare, childcare costs, and quality education for his kids are major concerns.

despite the financial challenges, james finds solace in his faith community. he is an active member of a local evangelical church, attending services every sunday and volunteering for various church programs. his religious beliefs shape his conservative values on social issues like abortion and lgbtq+ rights.

politically, james aligns with the republican party, though he holds some moderate views on economic policies that could benefit working-class families like his own. while supportive of pro-business initiatives, he also favors policies that create well-paying jobs and improve access to affordable healthcare and education in rural communities.

james is a registered voter who stays informed by frequently browsing news websites and participating in online discussions with like-minded individuals. he sees himself as a values voter, prioritizing candidates who share his religious beliefs and promise to protect traditional family structures.

overall, james' background as a lower-income, small-town family man deeply rooted in his faith community has forged his conservative leanings balanced with pragmatic concerns for economic stability and quality of life issues affecting his local area.
